definition: Wimbledon Championships (tennis)/abbr. for 溫布爾登網球公開賽|温布尔登网球公开赛[Wen1 bu4 er3 deng1 Wang3 qiu2 Gong1 kai1 sai4]
warm/lukewarm/temperature/to warm up/mild/soft/tender/to review (a lesson etc)/fever (TCM)/old variant of 瘟[wen1]

sentences.english: Q.Talking about legends, in 2003 you beat Pete Sampras in Wimbledon.
sentences.chinese: 談到傳奇，你在2003年的溫網打敗了桑普拉斯。
這是他首次獲得溫網冠軍。

sentences.english: Once he recaptures Paris, he’ll have a lot of confidence headed into Wimbledon.
sentences.chinese: 一旦他巴黎重溫，定會信心十足，直奔溫網寶座而去。

sentences.english: I can't play Wimbledon and it's my favourite tournament.
sentences.chinese: 我無法在溫網比賽，而這是我最喜歡的賽事。

sentences.english: Justine Henin wins the French Open, but not Wimbledon.
WIMBLEDON, England -- Start buying your tickets for next year's Wimbledon final.
sentences.chinese: 你現在可以先行買下明年的溫網決賽門票了。

sentences.english: It was the third of Graf's seven Wimbledon titles.
sentences.chinese: 這是格拉芙職業生涯7座溫網桂冠中的第三個。

sentences.english: Wimbledon is not a nighttime event, even if illumination is possible.
sentences.chinese: 儘管有照明設施，溫網也不會進行夜間比賽。

sentences.english: However, Kuznetsova says she has prepared well since Wimbledon.
sentences.chinese: 但庫茲涅佐娃說，她從溫網以來已經完全準備好了。

sentences.english: And after surgery, I got to the finals of Wimbledon.
sentences.chinese: 手術後，我殺進了溫網的決賽。

sentences.english: I think I was way too nervous at Wimbledon.
sentences.chinese: 我想在溫網決賽對陣沙拉波娃前我太緊張了。

definition: Lee Lai-Shan (1970-), former windsurfing world champion from Hong Kong
to mess sth up/to screw up
treasure knife does not age (idiom); old but still vigorous
Vanuatu, country in the southwestern Pacific Ocean
hat trick (when one player scores three goals)
